content: copycat cowl verna glass there s a popular beanie out there and this cowl resembles it easy purl and rib stitches with some simple increases help it puddle materials one skein worsted yarn sample was made with cascade lana d oro size 8 circular needle 16 -24 size 7 for bind off directions cast on 88 stitches on 8 s and join to work in the round place marker to indicate beginning of round i encourage you to try the chinese waitress cast on it makes a lovely chained edge here s a link to an excellent video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=ragbndhwjg8 knit 3 rounds purl 7 rounds knit one round knit 1 purl 1 - 6 rounds knit 1 round increasing 8 stitches k4 kfb * k10 kfb * repeat between * s to last 6 stitches k 6 96 sts purl 7 rounds knit 1 round knit 1 purl 1 6 rounds knit 1 round increasing 8 stitches k5 kfb * k11 kfb * repeat between * s to last 6 stitches k6 104 sts purl 7 rounds knit 1 round knit 1 purl 1 6 rounds knit 1 round increasing 8 stitches k5 kfb * k12 kfb * repeat between * s to last 7 stitches k7 112 sts purl 7 rounds knit 1 round knit 1 purl 1 6 rounds knit 1 round increasing 8 stitches k6 kfb * k13 kfb * repeat between * s to last 7 sts k7 120 sts purl 8 rounds turn to wrong side to bind off just turn work and work back the way you came using size 7 needle knit 2 knit those two together through the back loop tbl i find the easiest way is to knit them together as if you were doing an ssk insert left needle through the front of the stitches on the right needle and knit them together you will have 1 stitch on the left needle knit 1 and knit those 2 together tbl and repeat because you turned the work you will have to close any gap when you finish the bindoff join block gently
